body: • In a report about a letter from Simon Crowther to his MP that has been widely circulated online (‘We’ve been cheated’ letter from graduate goes viral, 26 May, page 6), we unintentionally implied that the interest rate on student loans had increased since he began his course. That is not the case: as the Department for Business, Innovation and Skills pointed out in a statement issued after the article was published, the variable interest rate for loans taken out after September 2012 has not been changed; it remains at 3% above inflation. • A long read article about Ada Colau (Is this the world’s most radical mayor?, 26 May, page 27) said incorrectly that she obtained a degree in philosophy at the University of Barcelona. Colau, who was elected as the first female mayor of the Catalan capital last year, did study philosophy there but did not complete her degree. • Homophone corner: “Back in the 1990s and early 2000s, it wasn’t common practice to commission organisations lead by service users” (‘My anxiety has been a motivator’, 25 May, page 37).
